perturbation.original_text:
“Affiliate” means an individual or legal entity that directly or indirectly, through one or more intermediaries, controls
or is controlled by, or is under common control with, another Person. The term “Control” as utilized herein means the
possession, directly or indirectly, of the power to direct or cause direction of the management and policies of a Person,
whether through management, ownership, by contract, or otherwise; provided, however, in no event shall Hydraspin be
deemed an Affiliate of the Distributor.
perturbation.changed_text:
“Affiliate” means an individual or legal entity that directly or indirectly, through one or more intermediaries, controls
or is controlled by, or is under common control with, another Person. The term “Control” as utilized herein means the
possession, directly or indirectly, of the power to influence the decisions of a Person, whether through management, ownership, by contract, or otherwise; provided, however, in no event shall Hydraspin be
deemed an Affiliate of the Distributor.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of "Control" requires the power to *direct* management and policies, implying significant authority. The changed definition uses the phrase "power to *influence* the decisions", which is much broader and could include entities with minimal authority. This weakens the concept of 'Affiliate', making it unclear who is bound by Affiliate-specific clauses elsewhere in the contract.

perturbation.original_text:
5.1 Orders. Distributor shall order Products from Hydraspin by submitting purchase orders and an installation plan identifying
the number(s) and type(s) of Products ordered, the requested delivery date(s) (each, an “Order”). The requested delivery date shall
be no less than 120 days from the date the Order is accepted by Hydraspin. Hydraspin will not unreasonably reject any Order for
Products. Hydraspin will accept or reject each Order submitted by Distributor within ten (10) days after receipt of the Order. Any
Orders not expressly rejected by Hydraspin within such ten (10) day period shall be deemed accepted by Hydraspin. Notwithstanding
the foregoing, Distributor may cancel any Order for Products that are not delivered within sixty (60) days after the delivery date
specified therein.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.1 Orders. Distributor shall order Products from Hydraspin by submitting purchase orders and an installation plan identifying
the number(s) and type(s) of Products ordered, the requested delivery date(s) (each, an “Order”). The requested delivery date shall
be no less than 120 days from the date the Order is accepted by Hydraspin. Hydraspin will not unreasonably reject any Order for
Products. Hydraspin will accept or reject each Order submitted by Distributor within ten (10) days after receipt of the Order. Any
Orders not expressly rejected by Hydraspin within such ten (10) day period shall be deemed accepted by Hydraspin. Notwithstanding
the foregoing, Distributor may cancel any Order for Products that are not delivered within one hundred and eighty (180) days after the delivery date specified therein.
perturbation.explanation: The original text allows the distributor to cancel an order if products are not delivered within 60 days of the delivery date. The modified text changes this cancellation window to 180 days. This creates a contradiction regarding when the distributor has the right to cancel an order due to late delivery, creating uncertainty and potential disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
10.3 Effect of Termination.
(a) Termination or expiration of this Agreement will not relieve either Party of any obligation incurred
hereunder prior to such termination or expiration. Each Party will be entitled to cancel any outstanding Orders, to the extent
Products have not been delivered. Hydraspin shall be entitled to retrieve its Products from the Customers at its sole cost and
expense.
(b) If termination is the result of a Change of Control, Distributor shall be entitled to receive a onetime
payment, within three (3) business days of the effective date of the Change of Control, equal to the greater of the following 1)
the aggregate amount of the Distributor Share received during the 18 months prior to the effective date of such Change of
Control or 2) the aggregate amount of the Distributor Share received on the 30 days prior to the effective date of such Change
of Control multiplied by 18.
perturbation.changed_text:
10.3 Effect of Termination.
(a) Termination or expiration of this Agreement will not relieve either Party of any obligation incurred
hereunder prior to such termination or expiration. Each Party will be entitled to cancel any outstanding Orders, to the extent
Products have not been delivered. Hydraspin shall be entitled to retrieve its Products from the Customers at the expense of the Distributor.
(b) If termination is the result of a Change of Control, Distributor shall be entitled to receive a onetime
payment, within thirty (30) business days of the effective date of the Change of Control, equal to the lesser of the following 1)
the aggregate amount of the Distributor Share received during the 18 months prior to the effective date of such Change of
Control or 2) the aggregate amount of the Distributor Share received on the 30 days prior to the effective date of such Change
of Control multiplied by 18.
perturbation.explanation: The original states Hydraspin retrieves the products at its own cost, while the modified text shifts this cost to the Distributor. In addition to this, the original text stipulates that the distributor is entitled to payment in three business days of a Change of Control event, while the edited text extends this to thirty days. This creates a timing conflict in payment. Finally, the original provides the distributor the 'greater' of two options related to payment, while the modified text uses the 'lesser', creating a financial conflict.
